article:
Yesterday I was having lunch at Subway. In the meantime, occasionally, I  _  a young man struggling to get his drink. He was spilling everything and making a  _  . As I got close, I noticed he was blind.
    I went over and  _  to help. I took him by the hand and  _  him to the table. I asked him if he    _  anything else and he said he was fine, so I left. 
   About two hours  _  I was heading to my car and the rain started pouring down. I took  _  in a nearby building, and then I saw the young blind man again. He was trying to cross the street and using his stick to make sure that  _  was in his way.
  I went up to him and said,"Hi!" He smiled and said, "Hey! You are the young lady who helped me at the   _  ."
    I smiled and said, "Yes."  _  I took him by the hand and led him across the street. I asked him  _  he knew I was the same person from the restaurant. He said he  _  my energy! He said he could feel it just like before!
   We  _  it to the other side of the street and he told me he was  _  now and could make the rest of the way on his own. So we said good-bye and went our separate  _    .
   As I got into my car I was all wet  _  I felt warm. I was glad I was able to be in both places to  _   that young man out even if it was very   _  . He helped me as well. He told me I had a positive energy and that made me feel great about myself. So   _  he is today, I hope he knows what a  _  it was for me to have those two moments with him.
